concept_data.title: right to respect for the human body

summary: The "right to respect for the human body," also referred to as the "right to physical integrity," is a fundamental principle enshrined in EU legal frameworks, emphasizing the inviolability of the human body. This right safeguards individuals against non-consensual medical interventions and bodily harm, reflecting the EU's commitment to human dignity and personal autonomy. It is closely linked to various legal instruments, including the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, which underscores the necessity of protecting physical integrity in healthcare and biomedicine. As a redirect to "right to physical integrity," it highlights the importance of maintaining clarity in legal terminology within EU regulatory contexts.
